source_type.AER: aerosol treatment in an atmospheric model where concentrations are calculated based on emissions, transformation, and removal processes (rather than being prescribed or omitted entirely)
source_type.AGCM: atmospheric general circulation model run with prescribed ocean surface conditions and usually a model of the land surface
source_type.AOGCM: coupled atmosphere-ocean global climate model, additionally including explicit representation of at least the land and sea ice
source_type.BGC: biogeochemistry model component that at the very least accounts for carbon reservoirs and fluxes in the atmosphere, terrestrial biosphere, and ocean
source_type.CHEM: chemistry treatment in an atmospheric model that calculates atmospheric oxidant concentrations (including at least ozone), rather than prescribing them
source_type.LAND: land model run uncoupled from the atmosphere
source_type.OGCM: ocean general circulation model run uncoupled from an AGCM but, usually including a sea-ice model
source_type.RAD: rad iation component of an atmospheric model run 'offline'
source_type.SLAB: slab-ocean used with an AGCM in representing the atmosphere-ocean coupled system

citation.article: An article from a journal, magazine, newspaper, or periodical.
citation.book: A book where the publisher is clearly identifiable.
citation.booklet: A printed work that is bound, but does not have a clearly identifiable publisher or supporting institution.
citation.inbook: A section, such as a chapter, or a page range within a book.
citation.inproceedings: A paper that has been published in conference proceedings.
citation.manual: A technical manual for a machine software such as would come with a purchase to explain operation to the new owner.
citation.masterthesis: A thesis written for the Masters level degree.
citation.misc: Used if 'none' of the other entry types quite match the source. Frequently used to cite web pages, but can be anything from lecture slides to personal notes.
citation.phdthesis: A thesis written for the PhD level degree.
citation.techreport: An institutionally published report such as a report from a school, a government organization, an organization, or a company. This entry type is also frequently used for white papers and working papers.
citation.unpublished: A document that has not been officially published such as a paper draft or manuscript in preparation.

calendar.standard: A mixed Gregorian/Julian calendar which is Gregorian after 1582-10-15, and Julian before.
calendar.proleptic_gregorian: A calendar with the Gregorian rules for leap-years extended to dates before 1582-10-15.
calendar.julian: The Julian calendar, in which a year is a leap year if it is divisible by 4, even if it is also divisible by 100.
calendar.360_day: A calendar in which all years are 360 days, and divided into 30 day months.
calendar.365_day: A calendar with no leap years, i.e. all years are 365 days long.
calendar.366_day: A calendar in which every year is a leap year, i.e. all years are 366 days long.
